summary: This appears to be an internal FBI New York Field Office situational report (SITREP) email for May 15, 2025. It includes a news summary reporting that a Jeffrey Epstein survivor is demanding the Trump Administration release case files, citing delays and a lack of transparency. The report references statements from Attorney General Pam Bondi and Deputy Director Dan Bongino regarding the volume of evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the case files whose release is being demanded. Described as having run a sex trafficking operation.

persons.name: Pam Bondi
persons.context: Quoted as stating the FBI is reviewing 'tens of thousands of videos' and that there are 'hundreds of victims,' explaining the delay in releasing files.

persons.name: Dan Bongino
persons.context: Quoted as saying the FBI is working with the DOJ on the Epstein case and dealing with voluminous amounts of child sexual abuse material.

events.title: Bondi comments on Epstein evidence review
events.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi told reporters the FBI is reviewing 'tens of thousands of videos' of Epstein with children or involving child porn, citing 'hundreds of victims' as reason for delay in releasing files.

events.title: Epstein survivor demands file release
events.description: A survivor of sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein urged the Trump Administration to release the case files about him, criticizing the delay and lack of transparency.

events.title: 21st Floor IOC closure for renovations
events.description: The 21st Floor, 26 Federal Plaza IOC (likely an FBI office) closed for renovations from January 12, 2025 through May 2025.

keyFacts: A Jeffrey Epstein survivor is publicly demanding the Trump Administration release the Epstein case files, citing an 'ongoing cover-up and extreme lack of transparency.'
Attorney General Pam Bondi stated the FBI is reviewing 'tens of thousands of videos' of Epstein with children or involving child pornography, and that there are 'hundreds of victims.'
Deputy Director Dan Bongino confirmed the FBI is working with the DOJ on the case and dealing with 'voluminous amounts of downloaded child sexual abuse material.'
The document is formatted as an FBI New York Field Office situational report (SITREP) dated May 15, 2025, indicating an internal operational context.
The news summary suggests significant delays and bureaucratic hurdles are preventing the public release of investigative files related to Epstein's sex trafficking operation.
